Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Tuesday March 25), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for tuesday, march 25th. 

microsoft is gearing up to unveil a new line of surface products at their upcoming spring event. leaks suggest we might see a revamped surface laptop and an upgraded surface pro. analysts are keeping a close eye on microsoft as it seeks to maintain its competitive edge in the hardware market. this comes amid increased pressure from tech rivals like apple and google, both of which have intensified their forays into premium computing devices this year.

meanwhile, meta is set to roll out its newest virtual reality headset, quest pro, later this month. ceo mark zuckerberg has emphasized the device's focus on professional use, hoping to boost adoption in the corporate space. the unveiling comes at a crucial time as meta strives to cement its presence in the burgeoning virtual reality arena, an area they're betting on heavily for future growth.

google faces a new antitrust challenge in the european union concerning dominance in the online ad market. regulators are scrutinizing google’s advertising tech, which has reportedly given itself unfair advantages. this follows a series of ongoing global regulatory pressures on big tech, as calls for tighter oversight and fair competition grow louder.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for tuesday, march 25th.

microsoft is gearing up for its spring event, where the tech giant is expected to unveil a new line of surface products. insider leaks hint at a revamped surface laptop and an upgraded surface pro. industry analysts are keeping a close watch as microsoft aims to fortify its position in the competitive hardware market. this move comes amid heightened competition from tech rivals such as apple and google, both of which have ramped up their efforts in the premium computing device sector this year.

meanwhile, meta is preparing to launch its latest virtual reality headset, the quest pro, later this month. ceo mark zuckerberg has highlighted the device's professional use, hoping to see increased adoption in the corporate sector. this launch is critical for meta as it aims to strengthen its standing in the burgeoning virtual reality field, a venture they are heavily banking on for future growth.

shifting focus to the european union, where google faces a fresh antitrust challenge over its dominance in the online ad market. eu regulators are examining google's advertising technology practices, which have reportedly provided the company with unfair advantages. this development is part of a broader global push for tighter oversight on big tech, with increasing calls for fair competition and accountability.

that's all for today's briefing. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-242 Microsoft's Surface Lineup Unveiling 💻, Meta's Quest Pro Launch 🎮, Eu's Antitrust Challenge to Google 🏛️
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for tuesday, march 25th! explore today's technology discussions:

  • microsoft's upcoming spring event: anticipation surrounds the unveiling of new surface products, including a revamped surface laptop and upgraded surface pro, as microsoft seeks to strengthen its hardware market presence amidst competition from apple and google.
  • meta's quest pro launch: meta is set to release its latest virtual reality headset, focusing on professional use to increase corporate adoption, a strategic move for future growth in the vr industry.
  • google's new eu antitrust challenge: the european union investigates google's ad market dominance, scrutinizing its advertising technology practices in a broader effort to enforce competitive fairness and accountability for big tech companies.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image depicting a futuristic cityscape at dusk, with the skyline dominated by the sleek architecture of microsoft's surface buildings. in the foreground, a cutting-edge virtual reality headset reminiscent of meta's quest pro floats, casting a vibrant holographic display that seamlessly merges with the digital skyline. the holograms showcase interactive elements and gaming visuals, symbolizing immersive experiences. to the right, a grand courthouse structure emerges from the cityscape, embodying the eu's monumental antitrust challenge to google. the courthouse is subtly intertwined with digital data streams, representing the tech and legal worlds converging. all elements are harmoniously integrated, creating a vibrant scene that reflects the innovation and challenges in the tech industry
